Class UserInteraction

  • java.lang.Object
    • UserInteraction
  • public class UserInteraction
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains all the interactions with the user, asks all the questions, prints all the messages and collects the data that we need from the users.

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      UserInteraction()

      void announcingCategory​(Questions question)
      Function announcingCategory accepts a Questions type object and announces the category of the question to the player.
      void announcingTheType​(Type type)
      Function announcingTheType accepts a Type object and prints a message that announces the type name through the getName method.
      void askTheQuestion​(Questions question)
      This void function accepts a Questions type object and prints the question and the four possible answers.
      int betPoints​(Player player)
      BetPoints function, asks the player to bet and saves the amount in an int variable.
      void correctAnswer​(Questions question)
      This function prints the correct answer to the question asked previously.

      finalScores prints the scores of each player at the end of the game
      java.lang.String getAnAnswer​(Player player)
      This method accepts a Player object, asks the player for an answer and returns the input.

      Function God, creates the human beings of this game.

      newBetPoints is a function that is called when the player types a non acceptable amount to bet.
      void showRoundScores​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
      The function showRoundScores is called at the end of each round, to show the current score of the players.
      void whoWon​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
      whoWon is a void function that is called after each question and it announces who answered correctly and who didn't by checking their status.

    • Method Detail

      • God

        public Player God()
        Function God, creates the human beings of this game. Asks for the name of the player, creates a Player object with that name that is going to be added to the playerList.
        Returns:
        A Player object

      • betPoints

        public int betPoints​(Player player)
        BetPoints function, asks the player to bet and saves the amount in an int variable.
        Returns:
        the betPoints variable, which contains the points bet by the player.

      • newBetPoints

        public int newBetPoints​(Player player)
        newBetPoints is a function that is called when the player types a non acceptable amount to bet. It informs the user about their mistake and asks for a new bet.
        Returns:
        the new bet which is an integer.

      • announcingCategory

        public void announcingCategory​(Questions question)
        Function announcingCategory accepts a Questions type object and announces the category of the question to the player.
        Parameters:
        question - the question about to be asked

      • announcingTheType

        public void announcingTheType​(Type type)
        Function announcingTheType accepts a Type object and prints a message that announces the type name through the getName method. Then it explains the way you play the game depending on the type.

      • askTheQuestion

        public void askTheQuestion​(Questions question)
        This void function accepts a Questions type object and prints the question and the four possible answers.

      • getAnAnswer

        public java.lang.String getAnAnswer​(Player player)
        This method accepts a Player object, asks the player for an answer and returns the input.
        Returns:
        String variable that contains the answer.

      • getNewAnswer

        public java.lang.String getNewAnswer​(Player player)
        getNewAnswer is called when the player types an answer that does not exist and asks for a new input.
        Returns:
        String that contains the new answer.

      • correctAnswer

        public void correctAnswer​(Questions question)
        This function prints the correct answer to the question asked previously.

      • whoWon

        public void whoWon​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
        whoWon is a void function that is called after each question and it announces who answered correctly and who didn't by checking their status.

      • showRoundScores

        public void showRoundScores​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
        The function showRoundScores is called at the end of each round, to show the current score of the players.

      • finalScores

        public void finalScores​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
        finalScores prints the scores of each player at the end of the game
        Parameters:
        players - is the ArrayList with all the players.
